attribute¶

attribute.keyword¶

class attribute.keyword.KeywordExtractor[source]¶

Bases: attribute.extractor.Extractor

Base class of extracting keywords

get_keywords()[source]¶
class attribute.keyword.TFIDFKeywordExtractor(list_of_list_of_lines, vocab_size, n_keywords=1)[source]¶

Bases: attribute.keyword.KeywordExtractor

Use tf-idf to extract keywords from each bag of words

Parameters:
  • list_of_list_of_lines (list) – a list of list of numpy arrays representing list_of_list_of_lines of words.
  • n_keywords (number, optional) – number of keywords want to extract, defaults to 1
 
from utils import Doc
Doc.load()
list_of_list_of_lines = [doc.get_lines() for doc in Doc.get_corpus()]
TFIDFKeywordExtractor(list_of_list_of_lines, len(Doc.get_vocab()))
get_keywords()[source]¶

Return the keywords of input list_of_list_of_lines.

Warning: not all the return values have exact n_keywords

Returns:a list looks like the input. Except that the sequence of sentence now become a list of keywords.
